name: kyphoplasty or vertebral augmentation
description: A surgical procedure performed to alleviate pain caused by vertebral compression fractures, to stabilize the spine, and to restore lost vertebral body height due to compression fracture.

attributes.name: location
attributes.description: The specific vertebrae where the procedure has been performed

values.name: stable compression
values.description: No change in the degree of compression of the vertebrae

values.name: height loss
values.description: Loss in height of the vertebrae

values.name: degenerative changes
values.description: Changes associated with the aging process

values.name: exaggerated kyphosis
values.description: Increased backward curve of the spine

values.name: compression deformities
values.description: Deformities due to pressure on the vertebrae

attributes.name: additional findings
attributes.description: Additional findings associated with the spine

values.name: osteopenia
values.description: Decreased bone density, but not as severe as osteoporosis

values.name: skeletal degenerative changes
values.description: Changes associated with the aging process affecting the skeleton

values.name: lytic or blastic lesions
values.description: Abnormalities in the bone suggestive of tumors or metastasis

values.name: multilevel wedge deformities
values.description: Deformities affecting multiple levels of the spine, characterized by a wedge-like shape of the vertebrae
